messages.message:
<!here> just FYI. We will be rebuilding all our base images for the upcoming release.
```
What does it mean for you?
- If you use docker for local development, your builds will take a loooong time the first time you build after base image rebuilds. All subsequent builds will be faster and back to normal speeds.
```
```
Why do we build base images often?
1. To fix security vulnerabilities. Ubuntu has a new high security vuln. https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-14835
2. To receive periodic updates from Ubuntu.
```
Please expect these base images to be updated at least once every one month.
```
How can we reduce pain for developers who use docker for development?
- We will investigate whether developers can use prebuilt docker images for their local development.
```
cc @Handsome Dave, Will (avoiding a mention for Will since he is OOO)
